p: Unsaturated fatty acids can be characterized on the basis of the cis- or trans- orientation of the double bonds. Usually, natural fatty acids carry a cis- configuration, although some trans-fatty acids can also occur in foods as a consequence of the hydrogenation process, which can move double bonds from their naturally occurring position to a trans-configuration [ 143]. Trans-fatty acids are considered undesirable compounds in foods, as their intake is associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular and metabolic diseases [ 145].
